channel.title: My computer is better & cheaper than yours!
channel.description:
Well ebay is my friend! Especially when i get an AMSTRAD PCW9512 for £3.19, computer, printer! All works! I'm going to collect it soon so I'll take some pictures and maybe print out something to put in the notepad when it gets to me. :)
Specs:
NAME PCW 9512+ MANUFACTURER Amstrad TYPE Professional Computer ORIGIN United Kingdom YEAR 1987 END OF PRODUCTION 1994 KEYBOARD Full-stroke 82 key with function keys, numeric keypad and special editing keys (COPY, CUT, PASTE, PRINT,etc.) CPU Zilog Z80 A SPEED 4 MHz RAM 512 KB ROM No ROM chip. Bootstrap loader is masked onto a custom chip. TEXT MODES 90 xchars. x 35 lines GRAPHIC MODES 720 x 256 dots COLORS Monochrome (black & white) SOUND Beeper, 1 channel SIZE / WEIGHT 34.5 (W) x 34.5 (D) x 42 (H) cm I/O PORTS Z80 Bus, Parallel BUILT IN MEDIA One Hitachi 3.5'' disk-drive (720k) OS CP/M+ POWER SUPPLY Built-in power supply unit PERIPHERALS Printer, RAM an serial expansion units PRICE [s]£499[/s] [b]£3.19[/b]
Disscus how you are going to get a better computer than bootnecklad!
EDIT:
http://i13.ebayimg.com/07/i/001/37/53/d6db_1.JPG

item.title: My computer is better & cheaper than yours!
item.dc:creator: @bootnecklad bootnecklad
item.description:
@bootnecklad wrote:

[quote=“Fat Cookies, post:41, topic:266821”]Some guy is trying to sell this for over £40. £3.19 is a good deal

http://cgi.ebay.co.uk/AMSTRAD-PCW9512-VINTAGE-COMPUTER-BRAND-NEW_W0QQitemZ300300649286QQcmdZViewItemQQptZUK_VintageComputing_RL?hash=item300300649286&_trksid=p3286.c0.m14&_trkparms=72%3A1690|66%3A2|65%3A12|39%3A1|240%3A1318[/quote]

That’s because it’s brand new and contains the LOT!!! That’s only an hour away from me!!!

EDIT: I’m so buying that!

EDIT2: Fuck it’s a PCW9512, not a PCW9512+ SO… it has a 3" disk drive… fuck if I get that I’m going to need to get 3" disks lol…

Read full topic

item.title: My computer is better & cheaper than yours!
item.dc:creator: @bootnecklad bootnecklad
item.description:
@bootnecklad wrote:

[quote=“R.I.P RSC, post:38, topic:266821”][quote author=bootnecklad link=topic=352326.msg2708237#msg2708237 date=1237132106]

Wowowow I just found out that pc has the same cpu as my calculator, only mine has 15MHz and yours only 4.

I know! I just wow at how far technology has come on
[/quote]

Like I asked on IRC: How big is CP/M? And is there a way you can send me the source?[/quote]

It fits on a 720k floppy, I’ll look into forking off the source but the storage space on the calculator would probably need to be formatted to the correct CP/M format. I’ll try and stick in in my usb floppy and convert the files. Then I’ll pm them to you.

Read full topic

amd 8 core Agena
well that’s like 3000 times faster then that 4mhz processor :)[/quote]
12 Ghz, or 1.5 Ghz per processor core.
Most programs can one use 2 cores.
So its not so good.

item.title: My computer is better & cheaper than yours!
item.dc:creator: @bowserjr2 Bowser jr
item.description:
@bowserjr2 wrote:

[quote=“Niall, post:25, topic:266821”][quote author=Fat Cookies link=topic=352326.msg2704020#msg2704020 date=1236853759]

Greeny: Yes they do, Dual core computer is normal, and most home computers are over dual-core 1.5 ghz.

He was joking, and fyi, dual cores don’t work like that.

Some games are retarded and recognise the speed of one core of cpu and says your cpu is too slow.[/quote]

I know, I believe crysis did it for me, but multiple core processor’s don’t work by adding the speed of all the cores together.[/quote]
It look like Crysis need dual core processor with that speed. 2,2 Ghz Dual core on vista.

Read full topic
